results.brief_description: A memory film set in Belfast in 1981 during the IRA hunger strikes which led to the death and eventual martyrdom of Bobby Sands. Quiet and powerful, ‘81’ contains multiple points of view, alternating between Catholic and Protestant, women and men, youth and adults. What lingers and what haunts are the vivid stark images of the prisoners’ gaunt faces on the television sets; the determined set of Thatcher’s jaw; Bobby Sands’ eyes staring out from the posters glued haphazardly on the Belfast streets.

results.title: 800 miles of winter (TEFC)
results.brief_description: From the discovery of oil at Prudhoe Bay in 1968 to the loading of the first tankers at Valdez in 1977, this is the story of one of the most difficult and costly construction projects ever attempted. Almost 800 miles of big pipe was laid across three major mountain ranges and Arctic perma-frost, to reach an ice free port in south east Alaska. (Award: Golden Eagle, USA)

results.title: 80 channels under the sea
results.creator_credit: Ted Holliday, Supreme Sound Studios and Max Lemon
results.brief_description: Tells in simple terms, the story of the manufacture and laying of the first stage of the Commonwealth Pacific Cable across the Tasman Sea between Bondi and Auckland and the advantages that this new 80 channel coaxial submarine cable will bring: high quality, trouble free telephone, telegraph, telex-leased teleprinter, photo-telegraph and broadcast services between Australia, North America, Britain and Europe.

results.title: 8 Women = 8 Femmes
results.creator_credit: Fidelite Productions, France 2 Cinema, Mars Films, Olivier Delbosc, Marc Missonnier and Francois Ozon
results.brief_description: A homage to accomplished French actresses, Francois Ozon has conjured a musical/comedy/mystery film featuring an ensemble cast of 8 women snowed in in a French residence in the 1950s investigating the murder of the only man in the house - Marcel. Gaby (Catherine Deneuve), his gold digging and emotionally distant wife; eldest daughter Suzon (Virginie Ledoyen) who has returned home for Christmas; youngest daughter Catherine (Ludivine Sagnier); mother in law Mamy (Danielle Darrieux) a wheelchair bound alcoholic supported by Marcel, along with his sister in law Augustine (Isabelle Huppert) a repressed hypochondriac jealous of anyone more sexual than her, including new chamber maid and Marcel’s lover, Louise (Emmanuelle Beart) and Marcel’s sister, exotic dancer Pierette (Fanny Ardant). The 8 is completed by maid Chanel (Firmine Richard). Under the pressure of one another’s accusations and confined to the sumptuous and sterile indoor settings, secrets are revealed over the space of an evening as the women play Miss Marples in this savvy, satirical, musical “thriller”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fidelite Productions, France 2 Cinema, Mars Films, Olivier Delbosc, Marc Missonnier and Francois Ozon

results.title: 8 1/2 = Eight and a half [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Angelo Rizzoli, Cineriz, Francinex and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: After the international success of “La Dolce Vita” Fellini found himself in the position of an “overnight sensation”, with critics, audiences and cinema producers expecting his next film to be even more of a success. His predicament caused him to experience a self-doubting of his intellect and creativity, a self-doubt that he managed to commit to screen in this wonderful film. For “8 1/2” is about the struggle to create cinema; about the financial, creative, physical and mental exertions needed to produce a film. Marcello Mastroianni plays a film director, Guido Anselmi, who is beset by adoring fans, angry mistresses, nervous financial backers and hostile critics while in the process of directing his current film. Mixing autobiography, fantastical dream sequences, imaginative sets and starkly photographed childhood memories, “8 1/2” is the most entertaining and stimulating film ever made about film-making. Cast includes Claudia Cardinale, Anouk Aimee and Barbara Steele. Music score by Nino Rota. Voted second best film ever made by a “Sight and Sound” international poll in 1992. The film won the Best Foreign Film Oscar in 1963.

results.title: 7th Australian jamboree
results.brief_description: Attended by scouts from all over Australia and from 23 neighbouring countries at Dandenong, Victoria. Shows the official opening; presentation of silver kangaroo to sir Charles Maclean; visit by the Governor and Chief Scout of Victoria; demonstration of Maori cooking; girl guide pageant attended by Lady Delacombe; thanksgiving; arena displays by each state; closing parade and candlelight ceremony. No narration.

results.title: 700 Million Faces
results.creator_credit: Dennis Porter, Ian Austin and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a land of contradictions. Mrs. Ghandi discusses in an in-depth yet light-hearted and often amusing interview, India’s contemporary and greatly diversified lifestyles.

results.title: 7.30 Report: The Dismissal
results.brief_description:
On the eve of the thirtieth anniversary of the dismissal of the Whitlam government, a special edition of the ABC’s national nightly current affairs program, ‘7:30 Report’ takes an in-depth look at the events of 1975.

The program features interviews with both Gough Whitlam and Malcolm Fraser who comment on the events of 1975, discuss the possibility of 4 year fixed terms for both the House of Representatives and the Senate and reflect upon the politics of modern Australia, and upon each other.

Broadcast on 10th November, 2005.

results.title: 7 plus seven
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Fourteen children from a variety of school backgrounds, interviewed in 1964 for television about their hopes and aspirations, are followed up seven years later. Extracts from the first program, made when the children were seven years old, are shown and the children comment on any changes in their ideas.
